content:
You're welcome! Hot cocoa is a classic camping drink and it's easy to make over the fire. Here are some tips for making hot cocoa over the fire:

1. Bring a pot: You'll need a pot to heat the milk or water and cocoa powder. Make sure to choose a pot that is large enough to hold the amount of hot cocoa you want to make.

2. Use a whisk: Whisk the cocoa powder and sugar together before adding liquid. The whisk will help to break up any lumps that may have formed in the cocoa powder.

3. Heat the liquid: Heat the milk or water in a pot over the fire. Be careful not to let it boil or scorch the bottom of the pot.

4. Add the cocoa mixture: Once the liquid is heated, add the cocoa mixture to the pot and whisk until everything is well combined.

5. Add extras: You can add extras like vanilla extract, cinnamon, and whipped cream to your hot cocoa. Marshmallows are a classic addition for camping hot cocoa!

6. Enjoy your cup: Once the hot cocoa is ready, pour it into a cup or a mug and enjoy! 

Remember that cocoa powder tends to settle to the bottom of your drinking cup, so be sure to have a spoon handy to give it a quick stir before each sip. Enjoy the delicious combination of the hot cocoa and Dutch Oven Peach Cobbler!
